item.title: Homebrew: Remove All Dependencies for a Package
item.description: TLDR: Use the following command to remove a Homebrew package with all dependencies. $ pkg=[FORMULA]; brew rm ${pkg}; brew rm $(join <(brew leaves) <(brew deps ${pkg})) Homebrew is quite convenient when installing and upgrading packages, however, with a relatively large package (a.k.a formula), such as ffmpeg, Homebrew can end up installing numerous dependencies on your system. When we inspect the dependencies of ffmpeg we notice that the formula has over 20 dependencies that will get installed onto your system.
